title: Relay Render Packet v1
description: Immutable data contract between Relay backend (coordination physics) and frontend (visualization). Frontend MUST NOT recompute ERI, gradients, or constraints.

schema_version.description: Schema version for backwards compatibility checks

system_mode.description: SIMULATION = read-only (no commits), LIVE = gated commits allowed

generated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when packet was generated

policy_ref.description: Commit-addressed policy reference used to compute this packet (for auditability)

anchors.description: Array of anchor objects (workflows, policies, tasks, users, etc.)

streamlines.description: ERI gradient flows (repair paths, dependency flows)

membranes.description: Constraint fields (stage gates, authority, budgets, load, federation)

gates.description: Discrete valves in membranes (open/closed, with refusal reasons)

scars.description: Permanent reconciliation events (merges, policy changes, stage transitions)

eri.description: Raw ERI (Exposure Readiness Index) before confidence modulation

confidence.description: Confidence in ERI measurement (0 = no confidence, 1 = fully confident)

depth.description: Effective potential Ẽ = ERI × confidence (funnel depth for rendering)

blur.description: Blur level (recommended: 1 - confidence). No crisp funnel when confidence < 0.5

display_state.description: verified = high confidence, degraded = moderate confidence, indeterminate = low confidence (< floor)

magnitude.description: Gradient magnitude |∇E| (slope steepness, determines line thickness)

direction.description: downhill = -∇E (repair slope, lower ERI), uphill = +∇E (rising risk)

state.description: allowed = constraints satisfied, blocked = gate closed, unknown = not a repair path

active.description: true = constraint is blocking, false = constraint not active (membrane invisible)

reason_code.description: Stable refusal reason code when active (e.g., 'GLOBAL_STAGE_LOCK', 'AUTHORITY_EXPIRED')

explanation.description: Human-readable explanation of why constraint is active (optional)

state.description: open = action allowed, closed = refusal (gate computed by backend, NOT a UI toggle)

next_steps.description: Actionable next steps for user (e.g., 'Request delegation', 'Attach authorityRef')

commit_refs.description: Array of commit hashes involved in this scar (e.g., merge commits)

permanent.description: Scars are always permanent (cannot be hidden or removed)
